items.title: Indigo — Will the airline’s performance continue to fly high?
items.description: Increased cancellations due to geopolitical tension likely to impact yields in Q1 FY26

items.title: Repco Home Finance: Sustained loan growth to drive re-rating
items.description: Loan growth, asset quality improvement on the cards

items.title: Is Cantabil the next retail growth story?
items.description: At 18x FY27E earnings, CRIL offers an attractive valuation with strong operating leverage and improving demand visibility

items.title: Emcure net profit zooms 63% to Rs 197 crore in Q4FY25
items.description: The international segment recorded a 15.6 percent year-over-year growth in sales, reaching Rs 1,187 crore. This was significantly bolstered by a robust 39.3 percent growth in the rest of the world segment.

items.title: Antara Senior Care to invest Rs 500 crore to expand capacity fourfold
items.description: The company plans to ramp up its care home bed capacity to 2,000 beds and develop 10–12 new senior living communities.

items.title: Tamannaah Bhatia becomes brand ambassador of iconic Mysore Sandal Soap, signs Rs 6.2 crore deal
items.description: State-run Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Ltd (KSDL) signs Bollywood actor Tamannaah Bhatia as brand ambassador for two years as part of its strategy to expand beyond southern markets.

items.title: Hindalco bets on demand for aluminium cans if US consumption trend changes amid recession fears
items.description: Novelis derives about 60 percent of its product mix from beverage packaging, with the remainder spread across automotive, aerospace, and electronics sectors.

items.title: IndusInd Bank – Is the worst over?
items.description: The MFI book is large, which can aggravate business uncertainty, and definite clues are yet to emerge about the new CEO

items.title: Bajaj Auto aims to be majority owner of Austria's KTM, arm to provide €600 million to fund revival
items.description: Bajaj Auto, through its arm, will provide €600 million to KTM, supporting its restructuring and revival.

items.title: Strides Pharma Q4 net profit surges 5x on strong US sales
items.description: Strides also reduced its net debt by Rs 512.8 crore, bringing the net debt-to-EBITDA ratio down to 1.9x. The board recommended a dividend of Rs 4 per share for FY25.
